content.description: Start on 2 edges moves left following a slopey rail, Big move to the arete and finish up the height of the boulder on slopey holds.
content.location: This is on the new bike path near the Hopkinton/Milford line.  Park at the new lot for the bike path and walk south towards Milford.  This will be on the right just after a side road.  It is on the approach to Renaissance Man.

content.description: Start as far right as possible on some decent crimps. Traverse left using slopey feet on the face or heel hook the arete. Once you're under the mini-roof, pull up onto the block, and top out on the slab above.This has great movement and is a good warm-up for the harder Tom Sawyer problem.
content.location: Directly behind the Tom Sawyer problem is a slightly overhanging face with a block perched on top in the middle. Mean Stride starts on the right end of this face.

content.description: Tom Sawyer is a great boulder which unfortunately really only has one problem, but what a great problem it is!
